Publications

Our research is published in leading journals and conferences in linguistics, computer science, and cognitive science. Below is a selection of our recent publications.

2025

Journal Articles

  1. Awe, P., Chen, M., & Wilson, J. (2025). “Multilingual Language Models Reveal Cross-Linguistic Semantic Divergence.” Computational Linguistics, 51(2), 345-378.

  2. Johnson, S., Awe, P., & Lee, R. (2025). “Evaluating Cultural Bias in Large Language Models Across 50 Languages.” Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research, 74, 1123-1189.

  3. Chen, M., Zhang, L., & Awe, P. (2025). “Bilingual Advantage in Executive Control: A Meta-Analysis of 100+ Studies.” Bilingualism: Language and Cognition, 28(1), 45-67.

Conference Papers

  1. Wilson, J., Awe, P., & Patel, N. (2025). “Modeling Vocabulary Growth in Child Language Acquisition.” Proceedings of the 43rd Annual Conference of the Cognitive Science Society.

  2. Awe, P., Johnson, S., & Chen, M. (2025). “Low-Resource Language Processing with Cross-Lingual Transfer Learning.” Proceedings of the 2025 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP).

2024

Journal Articles

  1. Awe, P., Wilson, J., & Chen, M. (2024). “Cross-Linguistic Patterns in Bilingual Dyslexia: A Computational Analysis.” Journal of Learning Disabilities, 57(3), 234-256.

  2. Chen, M. & Awe, P. (2024). “Semantic Change Detection in Historical Corpora Using Neural Embeddings.” Digital Scholarship in the Humanities, 39(2), 567-589.

  3. Johnson, S., Awe, P., & Kim, Y. (2024). “Eye-Tracking Evidence for Predictive Processing in Bilingual Reading.” Journal of Memory and Language, 136, 104-123.

Conference Papers

  1. Awe, P., Chen, M., & Johnson, S. (2024). “Computational Assessment of Reading Fluency in Bilingual Children.” Proceedings of the 62nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL).

  2. Wilson, J. & Awe, P. (2024). “Individual Differences in Second Language Acquisition: A Computational Modeling Approach.” Proceedings of the 46th Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society.

2023

Journal Articles

  1. Awe, P., Lee, R., & Chen, M. (2023). “Code-Switching Patterns in Natural Bilingual Conversation: A Corpus-Based Study.” Language, 99(4), 789-812.

  2. Chen, M., Awe, P., & Wilson, J. (2023). “Cross-Linguistic Metaphor Comprehension: An ERP Study.” Brain and Language, 234, 105-118.

  3. Johnson, S. & Awe, P. (2023). “Cognitive Load in Simultaneous Interpretation: An EEG Study.” Interpreting, 25(1), 34-56.

Conference Papers

  1. Awe, P., Johnson, S., & Wilson, J. (2023). “Multimodal Data Integration for Language Assessment.” Proceedings of the 2023 Conference on Human Language Technology.

  2. Chen, M., Awe, P., & Zhang, L. (2023). “Semantic Space Alignment Across Languages.” Proceedings of the 2023 Conference on Computational Natural Language Learning (CoNLL).

2022 and Earlier

Selected Publications

  1. Awe, P. & Chen, M. (2022). “Bilingual Language Control: Evidence from fMRI and Behavioral Studies.” NeuroImage, 256, 119-134.

  2. Wilson, J., Awe, P., & Johnson, S. (2022). “Language Acquisition in Children with Developmental Language Disorder.” Journal of Speech, Language, and Hearing Research, 65(8), 2987-3005.

  3. Awe, P. (2021). “Computational Models of Bilingual Lexical Access.” Cognitive Science, 45(7), e13012.

  4. Chen, M., Awe, P., & Lee, R. (2020). “Cross-Linguistic Influence in Second Language Acquisition.” Studies in Second Language Acquisition, 42(4), 789-812.

Preprints & Working Papers

  1. Awe, P., Chen, M., & Johnson, S. (2025). “Large-Scale Evaluation of Multilingual Language Models.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2501.12345.

  2. Wilson, J. & Awe, P. (2024). “Computational Models of Syntax Acquisition: A Review.” PsyArXiv preprint.

  3. Chen, M., Awe, P., & Wilson, J. (2024). “Semantic Representations Across Languages: New Evidence from fMRI.” bioRxiv preprint.

Books & Book Chapters

  1. Awe, P. (2024). Computational Approaches to Bilingualism. Cambridge University Press.

  2. Chen, M. & Awe, P. (Eds.) (2023). Advances in Cross-Linguistic Research. Springer.

  3. Awe, P., Chen, M., & Johnson, S. (2022). “Computational Linguistics and Cognitive Science.” In The Oxford Handbook of Language and Cognition (pp. 345-367). Oxford University Press.

Data & Code Publications

We believe in open science and make our research materials available whenever possible:

  1. Bilingual Code-Switching Corpus (2023). Available at: https://github.com/coalab/code-switching-corpus

  2. Multilingual Language Model Evaluation Toolkit (2024). Available at: https://github.com/coalab/mlm-eval

  3. Bilingual Dyslexia Assessment Tools (2024). Available at: https://github.com/coalab/dyslexia-tools

Citation Metrics

  • Total Citations: 1,200+ (Google Scholar)
  • h-index: 18
  • i10-index: 32

Last updated: January 2025

Accessing Our Work

Most of our publications are available through:

  • Open Access: Many papers are available via arXiv or our institutional repository
  • Author Copies: PDFs available upon request
  • Repository: Preprints and code available on our GitHub organization

For copies of any publications not available through open access, please contact us.
